response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose and intent of this measure is to strengthen state fireworks laws. [CHUNK_1] Specifically, the measure amends various definitions relating to fireworks, increases certain penalties for fireworks offenses, establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnic, and establishes processes relating to the adjudication of fireworks infractions. [CHUNK_2] The measure also appropriates moneys. [CHUNK_2]",
  "appropriations": "The measure appropriates moneys. [CHUNK_2] The provided document does not specify the amount or fiscal years for the appropriation. [CHUNK_2]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided legislative documents do not contain specific assumptions or a methodology for calculating financial projections. [CHUNK_0] The document only indicates that the measure appropriates moneys without further detail. [CHUNK_2]",
  "agency_impact": "Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of the Attorney General; Honolulu Police Department; Hawaii County Police Department; Department of the Prosecuting Attorney, County of Maui; Hawaiian Humane Society; and four individuals. [CHUNK_3] Your Committee received written comments in opposition to this measure from Hawaii Explosives and Pyrotechnics and one individual. [CHUNK_4]",
  "economic_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any new information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "Your Committee recognizes the need to reform the State's approach to enforcing fireworks laws. [CHUNK_4] Your Committee believes that this measure appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework. [CHUNK_4] It also establishes a sensible penalty structure that imposes just consequences based on the severity of violations. [CHUNK_5]",
  "revenue_sources": "The provided legislative documents do not specify any revenue sources. [CHUNK_0] The measure appropriates moneys, but the source is not identified in the committee report. [CHUNK_2]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information on the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the impact on operating revenue. [CHUNK_0]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any mention of capital expenditures. [CHUNK_0]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information on the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_0]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "This fiscal note is based on a committee report which provides a high-level summary and does not contain the specific financial details, such as fee and fine amounts, that were present in the previous version of the bill. [CHUNK_5] The record of testimony has been updated to reflect new comments in support from entities including the Department of the Attorney General, various police departments, the Hawaiian Humane Society, and four individuals. [CHUNK_3] New opposition testimony was received from Hawaii Explosives and Pyrotechnics and one individual. [CHUNK_4]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any mention of the creation or modification of Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions. [CHUNK_0]",
  "appropriations_changes": "This version of the bill states that it appropriates moneys, but unlike the previous fiscal note, it does not specify the fiscal years for the appropriation. [CHUNK_2]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The provided legislative documents do not specify the method of funding or note any changes from previous versions. [CHUNK_0]",
  "department_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not specify which department is responsible for expending appropriations. [CHUNK_0]",
  "reports_required": "The provided legislative documents do not mention any reporting requirements. [CHUNK_0]",
  "pilot_program": "The provided legislative documents do not establish a pilot program. [CHUNK_0]",
  "sunset_date": "No sunset date is mentioned in the provided legislative documents. [CHUNK_0]",
  "effective_date": "No effective date is mentioned in the provided legislative documents. [CHUNK_0]"
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: SSCR1831 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1831 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 1483 H.D. 1 S.D. 1 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Ways and Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 1483, H.D. 1,

Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 1483, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO FIREWORKS," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to strengthen state fireworks laws. Specifically, the measure: (1) Amends various definitions relating to fireworks;

Specifically, the measure: (1) Amends various definitions relating to fireworks; (2) Increases certain penalties for fireworks offenses; (3) Establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnic; (4) Establishes processes relating to the adjudication of fireworks infractions; and (5) Appropriates moneys. Your Committee received written comments in

and (5) Appropriates moneys. Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of the Attorney General; Honolulu Police Department; Hawaii County Police Department; Department of the Prosecuting Attorney, County of Maui; Hawaiian Humane Society; and four individuals. Your Committee received written comments in opposition to

four individuals. Your Committee received written comments in opposition to this measure from Hawaii Explosives and Pyrotechnics and one individual. Your Committee recognizes the need to reform the State's approach to enforcing fireworks laws. Your Committee believes that this measure appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework and establishes

appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework and establishes a sensible penalty structure that imposes just consequences based on the severity of violations. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is

Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1483, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Ways and Means, ________________________________ DONOVAN M. DELA
the Committee on Ways and Means, ________________________________ DONOVAN M. DELA CRUZ, Chair

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.

No. 1483, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO FIREWORKS," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to strengthen state fireworks laws. Specifically, the measure: (1) Amends various definitions relating to fireworks;

Specifically, the measure: (1) Amends various definitions relating to fireworks; (2) Increases certain penalties for fireworks offenses; (3) Establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnic; (4) Establishes processes relating to the adjudication of fireworks infractions; and (5) Appropriates moneys. Your Committee received written comments in

and (5) Appropriates moneys. Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of the Attorney General; Honolulu Police Department; Hawaii County Police Department; Department of the Prosecuting Attorney, County of Maui; Hawaiian Humane Society; and four individuals. Your Committee received written comments in opposition to

four individuals. Your Committee received written comments in opposition to this measure from Hawaii Explosives and Pyrotechnics and one individual. Your Committee recognizes the need to reform the State's approach to enforcing fireworks laws. Your Committee believes that this measure appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework and establishes

appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework and establishes a sensible penalty structure that imposes just consequences based on the severity of violations. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is

Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1483, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading.
